00007 
00008 #import "NSXReturnThrowError.h"
00009 
00010 NSString *NSXErrorExceptionName = @"NSXError";
00011 NSString *NULLPointerErrorDomain = @"NULLPointerErrorDomain";
00012 NSString *BOOLErrorDomain = @"BOOLErrorDomain";
00013 
00014 typedef enum {
00015     NSXErrorCodeType_Unknown,
00016     NSXErrorCodeType_Cocoa,         //  "@"
00017     NSXErrorCodeType_PosixOrMach,   //  "i" (-1 == posix+errno, otherwise mach)
00018     NSXErrorCodeType_Carbon,        //  "s" || "l"
00019     NSXErrorCodeType_ptr,           //  "r*" || "*" || "^"
00020     NSXErrorCodeType_BOOL           //  "c"
00021 }   NSXErrorCodeType;
00022 
00023 static NSXErrorCodeType NSXErrorCodeTypeFromObjCType(const char *objCType) {
00024     switch (objCType[0]) {
00025         case 's':
00026         case 'l':
00027             return NSXErrorCodeType_Carbon;
00028         case 'i':
00029             return NSXErrorCodeType_PosixOrMach;
00030         case '@':
00031             return NSXErrorCodeType_Cocoa;
00032         case '^':
00033         case '*':
00034             return NSXErrorCodeType_ptr;
00035         case 'r':
00036             return '*' == objCType ? NSXErrorCodeType_ptr : NSXErrorCodeType_Unknown;
00037         case 'c':
00038             return NSXErrorCodeType_BOOL;
00039         default:
00040             return NSXErrorCodeType_Unknown;
00041     }
00042 }
00043 
00044 void NSXMakeErrorImp(const char *objCType_, intptr_t result_, const char *file_, unsigned line_, const char *function_, const char *code_, NSError **error_) {
00045     NSString *errorDomain = nil;
00046     int errorCode = (int)result_;
00047     
00048     switch (NSXErrorCodeTypeFromObjCType(objCType_)) {
00049         case NSXErrorCodeType_Cocoa:
00050             //  codeResult's type is an id/NSObject* pointer. 0 == nil == failure.
00051             if (0 == result_) {
00052                 errorDomain = @"NSCocoaErrorDomain"; // Could use NSCocoaErrorDomain symbol, but that would force us to 10.4.
00053                 errorCode = -1;
00054             }
00055             break;
00056         case NSXErrorCodeType_Carbon:
00057             //  codeResult's type is OSErr (short) or OSStatus (long). 0 == noErr == success.
00058             if (0 != result_) {
00059                 errorDomain = NSOSStatusErrorDomain;
00060             }
00061             break;
00062         case NSXErrorCodeType_PosixOrMach:
00063             //  codeResult's type is int, which is used for both posix error codes and mach_error_t/kern_return_t.
00064             //  0 means success for both, and we can differentiate posix error codes since they're always -1 (the
00065             //  actual posix code stored in errno).
00066             if (0 != result_) {
00067                 if (-1 == result_) {
00068                     //  Posix error code.
00069                     errorDomain = NSPOSIXErrorDomain;
00070                     errorCode = errno;
00071                 } else {
00072                     //  Mach error code.
00073                     errorDomain = NSMachErrorDomain;
00074                 }
00075             }
00076             break;
00077         case NSXErrorCodeType_ptr:
00078             //  codeResult's type is some sort of non-id/non-NSObject* pointer. 0 == NULL == failure.
00079             if (0 == result_) {
00080                 errorDomain = NULLPointerErrorDomain;
00081                 errorCode = -1;
00082             }
00083             break;
00084         case NSXErrorCodeType_BOOL:
00085             //  codeResult's type is a BOOL. 0 == NO == failure.
00086             if (0 == result_) {
00087                 errorDomain = BOOLErrorDomain;
00088                 errorCode = -1;
00089             }
00090             break;
00091         default:
00092             NSCAssert1(NO, @"NSXErrorCodeType_Unknown: \"%s\"", objCType_);
00093             break;
00094     }
00095 
00096     if (errorDomain) {
00097         *error_ = [NSError errorWithDomain:errorDomain
00098                                       code:errorCode
00099                                   userInfo:[NSDictionary dictionaryWithObjectsAndKeys:
00100                                       [NSString stringWithUTF8String:file_],   @"reportingFile",
00101                                       [NSNumber numberWithInt:line_],   @"reportingLine",
00102                                       [NSString stringWithUTF8String:function_], @"reportingMethod",
00103                                       [NSString stringWithUTF8String:code_], @"origin",
00104                                       nil]];
00105     }
00106 }
